bboxes.raw_text:
ATLANTA, Ga. = Kirkwood
Elementary School here. picketed
in August by Negro parents and
civil rights demonstrators be-
cause it did not accept Negro
students, will begin enrolling Ne
groes Immediately after the New
Year holiday.


The 422 while students now at
tending will have the option OF
remaining in the school or trans
ferring to other white elementary
schools.


Commenting on the shift to &C
ceptance of Negroes, Oby Brew
err, President of this citys Board
of Education, declared: We've
had to face up to the realities

Atlanta School to Enroll


Negroes at Start of New Year

CHICAGO Pianist singer
Dorothy Donegan voicedher opin-
ions concerning Negro enter
tainers during her recent en-
gagement at the Edgewater Beach
Hotel.


She aimed her scathing re-
marks at Negro entertainers who
marry whites and seemingly get
the best jobs. She named Lena
Horne and Eartha Kit as
examples.


Miss Donegan blasted the
hiring policy Of plush hotels and
C lubs which pay different salaries
to white and Negro performers.


She criticized Negro singers
for often overemphasizing sex in

of the situation. Our problem is
to get some additional space for
these Negro children and to give
the white children a chance to
make a choice"


Kirkwood, to the deep annoy
ance of Negro citizens, has had
empty classroom space, while
two nearby Negro elementary
schools are overcrowded.


City education authorities had
clashed sharply with the civil
rights movement in taking the
position that the school does not
come under the Atlanta grade
a-year desegregation plan until
the fall of 1865.

A salute to Dick Gregory who
interested people from coast to
coast in helping to make Mis-
sissippians enjoy a real Christ
mas with turkey and all the trim
mings and Mr.. Gregory made this
project one for all people regard
less of race, creed, color or
national origin.

Prentiss Nixon, IA yrs. old,
son of Mr.. and Mrs. Nixon, l547
West Tonic, was chosen "Boy
of the Month for December,
1864, at Homes Unit of the Boys
Club at 1901 West Sherman. The
award is given monthly for the
boy who is most outstanding in the
clubs library, gym, and all ath-
letic functions for that month.

>'BoY Of the Month -"


for Deem Der

their songs. She said that she
had stopped drinking SO she could
keep from ending up broke and
asking for benefit shows like
Dorothy cambridge or Ethel
Waters.


Miss Dongean said she had
never married because most men
only want to marry performer
because of her salary.

Rev. George Ward, 1922 West
Indian School Road, long time
collector of Lincoln's historical
writings and original picture with
exact likeness of Lincoln such as
the one Mr.. Ward Is showing
here next to a synopsis of Lin
coins Message to Congress in
December, 1864.
